channel.title: programming-language on Ankush Chadda
channel.description: Recent content in programming-language on Ankush Chadda

item.title: Introduction to Javascript
item.description: Data Types Javascript has 6 primitive data types number string boolean undefined null Symbol Objects Objects can store a collection of data types, which are then called properties. Each property has a key and value key is of string data types value can be of any data type. If a value is a functon, its called as a method Equality in Objects == or === only tests if both operands are same objects.

item.title: Scala Data Types
item.description: Scala’s unified type system Any is the super type Defines methods like - equals, hashCode, toString AnyVal represents value types. Double Float Long Int Short Byte Char Unit - Only one instance can be there - () Boolean AnyRef represent refernce types like List Nothing is subclass for all value types. Null is subclass for all reference types. Should not be used in Scala code.

item.title: Scala Introduction - The Basics
item.description: Significant points of Scala Developed by Martin Odersky in 2004.Â Is MultiParadigm - a blend of Functional and Object Oriented Paradigms Is statically typed Heavily uses Java libraries Encourages use of immutable data structures Basics Expressions are computable statements. For example 1+1 Values are names for results for expressions. Example val x = 1 + 1 These are immutable Variables are mutable names for expression results.
